definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Look, sexual chemistry with other people is normal, and feeling guilty about a crush is an exercise in futility.
sentences.chinese: 暗地的迷恋添入活跃感觉对现在两人是有益处的。

sentences.english: Praise shames me, for I secretly beg for it. ?
sentences.chinese: 荣誉羞着我，因为我暗地里追求着它。

sentences.english: He's married but he has a girl-friend on the side.
sentences.chinese: 他虽有妻室，但暗地里还有一个女朋友。

sentences.english: Xie Sheng doubts Deng Kai's capacity from beginning to end, two people begin stealthily fight.
sentences.chinese: 叶生始终怀疑邓凯的身份，两个人开始暗地里的斗争。

sentences.english: Some boys smoke on the sly.
It also prompted other princes to align quietly against them.
sentences.chinese: 但是也会使得其他亲王暗地里反对他们。

sentences.english: Then they promised to stop, but they secretly carried on.
sentences.chinese: 当时，他们承诺停工，但暗地里仍在施工。

sentences.english: He quietly reveled in the rivalry that grew between Anor and Vergere.
sentences.chinese: 拉在暗地里对阿诺和维婕尔之间的明争暗斗十分满意。

sentences.english: Now Butterfly confides to Pinkerton that she has secretly embraced Christianity.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶向平克顿吐露，她已暗地里信奉了基督教。

sentences.english: Your heart remains with you, you gaze upon it in the gloom with a shudder.
sentences.chinese: 心还是你的心，你在暗地里望着它发抖。

sentences.english: Terror is threatening with darkened sky and quaking earth.
sentences.chinese: 吞天暗地的恐怖让天空灰暗，大地震颤。

sentences.english: There is no man so bad but he secretly respects the good.
sentences.chinese: 再坏的人，至少都会在暗地里对正直之士心生敬意。

sentences.english: What is up and secretly and quietly solve, Doudoune Moncler Homme, every with the skill.
sentences.chinese: 有什么事情暗地里悄悄的解决，各凭本事。

sentences.english: It was this which secretly chagrined her.
Praise shames me- for I secretly plead with for it.
sentences.chinese: 荣誉使我感到羞惭，由于我暗地里求着它。

definition: in the dark/in secret/on the sly/surreptitiously
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
